parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
